framework.name: EFFECTIVE GOVERNANCE and PUBLIC SERVICE DELIVERY

children.name: By 2029, more young people and marginalized communities in Namibia actively participate in transparent gender-inclusive GOVERNANCE systems and institutions that prioritize accountability, transparency
Strengthened National Statistical System (NSS) for improved production and use of disaggregated and quality statistics for inclusive evidence-based planning and evaluation, with focus on young people

Strengthened institutional coordinating mechanisms (incl. GRN, CSOs, academia and the private sector) and young people and marginalized communities’ participatory capacity in decision-making processes

By 2029, Namibia has a diversified, resilient, and human rights ECONOMY that champions sustainable decent jobs, livelihoods and reduces inequalities inclusive of young people and marginalized communit
Strengthened productive capacities of institutions to implement sustainable, diversified economic value addition, with community shared ownership.

Enhanced gender-inclusive national capacity to develop and implement targeted initiatives for green, blue, purple, and orange jobs and just transitions, focusing on young people and marginalized commu
Strengthened implementation /delivery of diversified, innovative, and integrated financial sources and services, focusing on young people and marginalized communities.
Enhanced coordination and implementation of inclusive digital ecosystems, focusing on young people and marginalized communities.

framework.name: SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT and GREEN GROWTH OPPORTUNITIES

children.name: By 2029, Namibia has integrated gender-inclusive systems for sustainable management of NATURAL RESOURCES; reduced climate change vulnerability and enhanced resilience of marginalized communities and y
Strengthened implementation of targeted, evidencebased policies, strategic plans and programmes for sustainable natural resource management.
Strengthened capacities of institutions and marginalized communities for climate change resilience and disaster risk reduction.
children.description: Indicator aims to capture the number of food insecure population in Namibia, source for baseline is the IPC report published in September 2024 (projection1, October 2024 to March 2025 )

children.name: Strengthened implementation of evidence-based policies, strategic plans and programmes for renewable and affordable energy solutions (incl. green hydrogen, wind and solar energy), focusing on young pe
Establish the Namibia Centre of Excellence for Green Energy (N-CEGE)
children.description: Establish the Namibia Centre of Excellence for Green Energy (N-CEGE)

children.name: By 2029, young people, women, and marginalized communities, have equal access to, and use of quality, affordable, gender-inclusive, and human rights-sensitive BASIC SOCIAL SERVICES.

Strengthened national and sub-national capacities to efficiently deliver quality, affordable, gender-inclusive social and protection services, relying on evidence-based disaggregated quality data, foc

Strengthened mechanisms and capacities of communities and Frontline Service Providers (FLSPs) to promote positive and equitable gender social norms for gender equality and women empowerment, prioritiz
Strengthened capacity of rights holders to claim their rights and optimally utilise basic social and protection services, focusing on young people and marginalized communities.
